context: In 2005, Manhattan Associates was a leading provider of supply chain execution and warehouse management systems. The WMS market was growing as retailers and distribution centers sought to optimize operations. Key competitors included RedPrairie and HighJump as specialized WMS providers, while SAP and Oracle offered broader enterprise solutions. The market was beginning to evolve from pure WMS toward broader supply chain management platforms.
